data.title: Metal detecting
data.text: I went medal detecting there earlier this year and found quite a few $ in the lawn. Besides that they have a very interesting museum.

data.title: Great Place to Host An Event
data.text: My family has had graduations, weddings and soon a baby shower at this location.  I love the view of the hills and the fact that it is close to home but a very nice location amongst nature.

data.title: Magnificent scenery
data.text: A true gem of a park! Views of the mountains, cattle, & cacti were truly wonderful. During the day is the best time to visit as it's also a residential area

data.title: great picnic area and view of the mountains
data.text: this is a great place to have a family picnic and or play fooball or kick a soccer ball with your kids , you can rent the picnic area for $60 from the recreation center 408-586-3210 and have a party there are bathrooms and benches you might want to bring a pop up shade for the food table great location

data.title: Historic Jose Higuera Adobe Park - History, Picnics, and Play
data.text:
We have enjoyed visiting several times Jose Higuera Adobe Park in Milpitas.  It is a historical park as well as a local park with picnic tables, barbecue areas; children’s play area.  The historic adobe building was built by Jose Higuera.

Jose Higuera was the last Spanish governor of California.  In 1828, Higuera built the adobe house which is seen at the park.  The labor for the house was provided by the Ohlone Indians. A prickly pear cactus was planted to serve as a hedge; the cactus is still in the park today.

The historic adobe building is used for events.   We have enjoyed picnics and barbecues here.  There is also a children’s playground here. The park is also a convenient stopping place if you are biking the hill route streets.
